Software and Computing Roundtable

The Software and Computing Roundtable is a general series of meetings on topical matters for the nuclear and high-energy physics community, which is organised jointly by Jefferson Lab, Brookhaven National Lab and the HEP Software Foundation.

The Roundtable has historically had particularly strong links to the nuclear physics community, but is now expanding to be the perfect meeting point with high-energy physics.

  • Roundtable Home
  • Roundtable Meetings in 2021
  • Roundtable Meetings in 2020

If you would like to suggest a topic for the Roundtable, please contact the HSF Coordination. The current HSF representative is Graeme Stewart.
